intro: Camissonia boothii var. condensata, commonly known as the condensed camissonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Camissonia boothii var. condensata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
